tags — shows all the tags on an object with their values¶

Show the list of tags (and their values) present on an objects

FORM

tags [flags] <object specifier>

EXAMPLES

When authenticated as user alice:

$ fish tags "Eiffel Tower"
Object with about="Eiffel Tower":
/objects/93bd1999-0998-49cc-8004-af457ce34ce4
  alice/seen
  fluiddb/about = "Eiffel Tower"
  alice/rating = 7
  alice/index/about
  alice/location = "Paris"

Alternative specifications:

tags -a "Eiffel Tower"
tags -i 93bd1999-0998-49cc-8004-af457ce34ce4
tags -q 'fluiddb/about matches "Eiffel Tower"'

NOTE FOR WINDOWS USERS Working from a Windows command line, single quotes do not work as above. Instead you need to use double quotes and “stutter” quotes inside quotes. So the last example becomes:

tags -q "fluiddb/about matches """Eiffel Tower"""

All of these commands will show the names and values of all the tags (for which the user has read permission) from the object with about tag “Eiffel Tower” and ID 93bd1999-0998-49cc-8004-af457ce34ce4; The last one may also show other objects since the query

fluiddb/about matches "Eiffel Tower"

is search-engine-style string match that will match any about tag containing the words Eiffel and Tower, ignoring case, other words and punctuation.

Previous topic

get — gets the values (only) of tags on objects

Next topic

count — counts the number of objects satisfying a query
